required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Culinary Art Therapy Group for Adults With Eating Disorders.
clinical_study.official_title: Culinary Art Therapy Group for Adults With Eating Disorders: Assessment of Influence on Thinking, Patterns and Behaviour Related to Food.

brief_summary.textblock: The study will assess the influence of culinary art therapy group (a new therapeutic tool) for adults with eating disorders. It will assess changes in thinking patterns and behavioural patterns associated with food and eating.

primary_outcome.description: This is a screening measure to help determine whether a person might have an eating disorder that needs professional attention. This screening measure is not designed to make a diagnosis of an eating disorder or take the place of a professional consultation.
The EMPSA is a 12-item self-report assessment tool designed to measure eating disordered clients' perceived ability and motivation to perform 12 eating and meal preparation tasks.
The Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale (RSES) assesses global self-esteem and sense of self-worthiness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Communication and Interaction Skills (ACIS)
secondary_outcome.description: The ACIS is an observational assessment that gathers data on communication and interaction skills. Three domains, physicality, information exchange, and relations, are used to describe different aspects of communication and interaction. The ACIS gathers data on skill as it is exhibited during performance in an occupational form and/or within a social group.
Interviews aimed to allow each participant to relate to his or her own experience in a more independent and possibly safer setting.

arm_group.description: Patients with eating disorders that will participate in a weekly session of culinary art therapy group.
Patients with eating disorders that are not scheduled to come to the outpatients ward on the day of intervention.

intervention.description: Culinary art therapy is a novel approach which broadly perceives food and cooking as enabling participants to explore needs, patterns and relationships and facilitate therapeutic processes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of eating disorder
- Body Mass Index (BMI) > 15
Exclusion Criteria:
- No active participation in three group sessions
- Refusal to take an active part in the sessions

facility.name: Eating disorders outpatients department, Hadassah Medical Center
